column4: yeah, i agree with that 100%. Great philosophy behind Linux, and particuarly Ubuntu. From what i've read the founder is a pretty generous guy. It's the main reason i chose this distro instead of others ...

actually nix systems do things a bit differently.   While a few worms are malignant on linux boxes the general rule is that almost every new worm is a strain off of a previous one due to the actual inabilities of malware writers to come up with anything new
that fact coupled with the way linux files are written and stored fairly well precludes any major linux problem
dont misunderstand now, there are insecurities and there are program hacks... but the basic os is fairly free from destruction
